lead_paragraph: To the Editor: It may well be, as David Gelernter concludes in ''A Religion of Special Effects'' (Op-Ed, March 30), that ''the weakest die'' in our nation's climate of impoverished spirituality. But what is most upsetting about the Rancho Santa Fe cultists' deaths is that on their video they display no signs of such weakness. There is no perceptible misery, incompetence or maladjustment driving them.
abstract: Michael Tenzer letter comments on David Gelernter's March 30 Op-Ed article on mass suicide by members of Heaven's Gate cult in California (S)

headline.main: Cultists' Deaths Call Our Insight Into Question
